post.description: Simulate matching the given index name against the index templates in the system.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Index or template name to simulate

parameters.name: create
parameters.description:
If `true`, the template passed in the body is only used if no existing
templates match the same index patterns. If `false`, the simulation uses
the template with the highest priority. Note that the template is not
permanently added or updated in either case; it is only used for the
simulation.

parameters.name: expand_wildcards
parameters.description:
Type of index that wildcard patterns can match.
If the request can target data streams, this argument determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams.
Supports comma-separated values, such as `open,hidden`.
Valid values are: `all`, `open`, `closed`, `hidden`, `none`.

get.description: Allows a user to validate a potentially expensive query without executing it.

post.description:
Updates an alias to point to a new index when the existing index
is considered to be too large or too old.

parameters.name: cluster_manager_timeout
parameters.description: Operation timeout for connection to cluster-manager node.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description:
Comma-separated list of indices to delete.
You cannot specify index aliases.
By default, this parameter does not support wildcards (`*`) or `_all`.
To use wildcards or `_all`, set the `action.destructive_requires_name` cluster setting to `false`.

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description:
Period to wait for a response.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

parameters.name: master_timeout
parameters.description:
Period to wait for a connection to the master node.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.
parameters.x-deprecation-message: To promote inclusive language, use 'cluster_manager_timeout' instead.

parameters.name: ignore_unavailable
parameters.description: If `false`, the request returns an error if it targets a missing or closed index.

parameters.name: allow_no_indices
parameters.description:
If `false`, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias, or `_all` value targets only missing or closed indices.
This behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices.

parameters.name: cluster_manager_timeout
parameters.description: Operation timeout for connection to cluster-manager node.

parameters.name: expand_wildcards
parameters.description:
Type of index that wildcard patterns can match.
If the request can target data streams, this argument determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams.
Supports comma-separated values, such as `open,hidden`.
Valid values are: `all`, `open`, `closed`, `hidden`, `none`.

get.description: Returns information about one or more indices.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and index aliases used to limit the request.
Wildcard expressions (*) are supported.

parameters.name: local
parameters.description: If true, the request retrieves information from the local node only. Defaults to false, which means information is retrieved from the master node.

parameters.name: ignore_unavailable
parameters.description: If false, requests that target a missing index return an error.

parameters.name: allow_no_indices
parameters.description:
If false, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias, or _all value targets only
missing or closed indices. This behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices. For example,
a request targeting foo*,bar* returns an error if an index starts with foo but no index starts with bar.

parameters.name: expand_wildcards
parameters.description:
Type of index that wildcard expressions can match. If the request can target data streams, this argument
determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams. Supports comma-separated values,
such as open,hidden.

parameters.name: flat_settings
parameters.description: If true, returns settings in flat format.

parameters.name: include_defaults
parameters.description: If true, return all default settings in the response.

parameters.name: master_timeout
parameters.description: Period to wait for a connection to the master node. If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.
parameters.x-deprecation-message: To promote inclusive language, use 'cluster_manager_timeout' instead.

parameters.description: Operation timeout for connection to cluster-manager node.

parameters.name: ignore_unavailable
parameters.description: If `false`, the request returns an error if it targets a missing or closed index.

parameters.name: allow_no_indices
parameters.description:
If `false`, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias, or `_all` value targets only missing or closed indices.
This behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices.

parameters.name: expand_wildcards
parameters.description:
Type of index that wildcard patterns can match.
If the request can target data streams, this argument determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams.
Supports comma-separated values, such as `open,hidden`.
Valid values are: `all`, `open`, `closed`, `hidden`, `none`.

parameters.description: If `true`, returns settings in flat format.

parameters.description: If `true`, return all default settings in the response.

put.description: Creates an index with optional settings and mappings.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: Name of the index you wish to create.

parameters.name: wait_for_active_shards
parameters.description:
The number of shard copies that must be active before proceeding with the operation. 
Set to `all` or any positive integer up to the total number of shards in the index (`number_of_replicas+1`).

parameters.name: index
parameters.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and aliases used to limit the request.
Supports wildcards (`*`).
By default, you must explicitly name the indices you using to limit the request.
To limit a request using `_all`, `*`, or other wildcard expressions, change the `action.destructive_requires_name` setting to false.
You can update this setting in the `opensearch.yml` file or using the cluster update settings API.

parameters.name: allow_no_indices
parameters.description: Whether to ignore if a wildcard indices expression resolves into no concrete indices. (This includes `_all` string or when no indices have been specified).

schema.description: Whether to ignore if a wildcard indices expression resolves into no concrete indices. (This includes `_all` string or when no indices have been specified).

parameters.name: expand_wildcards
parameters.description: Whether to expand wildcard expression to concrete indices that are open, closed or both.

parameters.name: ignore_unavailable
parameters.description: Whether specified concrete indices should be ignored when unavailable (missing or closed).

schema.description: Whether specified concrete indices should be ignored when unavailable (missing or closed).

parameters.name: wait_for_completion
parameters.description: Should this request wait until the operation has completed before returning.

schema.description: Should this request wait until the operation has completed before returning.

parameters.name: only_ancient_segments
parameters.description: If true, only ancient (an older Lucene major release) segments will be upgraded.

schema.description: If true, only ancient (an older Lucene major release) segments will be upgraded.

get.description: Allows a user to validate a potentially expensive query without executing it.

post.description: Allows a user to validate a potentially expensive query without executing it.

analyzer.description:
The name of the analyzer that should be applied to the provided `text`.
This could be a built-in analyzer, or an analyzer thats been configured in the index.

attributes.description: Array of token attributes used to filter the output of the `explain` parameter.

char_filter.description: Array of character filters used to preprocess characters before the tokenizer.

explain.description: If `true`, the response includes token attributes and additional details.

filter.description: Array of token filters used to apply after the tokenizer.

normalizer.description: Normalizer to use to convert text into a single token.

schema.description: Define analyzer/tokenizer parameters and the text on which the analysis should be performed

settings.description: Configuration options for the target index.

schema.description: The configuration for the target index (`settings` and `aliases`)

is_write_index.description:
If `true`, sets the write index or data stream for the alias.
If an alias points to multiple indices or data streams and `is_write_index` isnt set, the alias rejects write requests.
If an index alias points to one index and `is_write_index` isnt set, the index automatically acts as the write index.
Data stream aliases dont automatically set a write data stream, even if the alias points to one data stream.

schema.description: The settings for the alias, such as `routing` or `filter`

composed_of.description:
An ordered list of component template names.
Component templates are merged in the order specified, meaning that the last component template specified has the highest precedence.

priority.description:
Priority to determine index template precedence when a new data stream or index is created.
The index template with the highest priority is chosen.
If no priority is specified the template is treated as though it is of priority 0 (lowest priority).
This number is not automatically generated by Opensearch.

schema.description: The template definition

date_detection.description: Controls whether dynamic date detection is enabled.

dynamic_date_formats.description:
If date detection is enabled then new string fields are checked
against 'dynamic_date_formats' and if the value matches then
a new date field is added instead of string.

dynamic_templates.description: Specify dynamic templates for the mapping.

numeric_detection.description: Automatically map strings into numeric data types for all fields.

properties.description:
Mapping for a field. For new fields, this mapping can include:

- Field name
- Field data type
- Mapping parameters

schema.description: The mapping definition

index_patterns.description:
Array of wildcard expressions used to match the names
of indices during creation.

order.description:
Order in which Opensearch applies this template if index
matches multiple templates.

Templates with lower 'order' values are merged first. Templates with higher
'order' values are merged later, overriding templates with lower values.

schema.description: The template definition

aliases.description:
Aliases for the target index.
Data streams do not support this parameter.

settings.description:
Configuration options for the index.
Data streams do not support this parameter.

schema.description: The conditions that needs to be met for executing rollover

aliases.description:
The key is the alias name.
Index alias names support date math.

settings.description: Configuration options for the target index.

schema.description: The configuration for the target index (`settings` and `aliases`)

settings.description: Configuration options for the target index.

schema.description: The configuration for the target index (`settings` and `aliases`)
The query definition specified with the Query DSL
The definition of `actions` to perform
The data stream definition

allow_auto_create.description:
This setting overrides the value of the `action.auto_create_index` cluster setting.
If set to `true` in a template, then indices can be automatically created using that template even if auto-creation of indices is disabled via `actions.auto_create_index`.
If set to `false`, then indices or data streams matching the template must always be explicitly created, and may never be automatically created.

composed_of.description:
An ordered list of component template names.
Component templates are merged in the order specified, meaning that the last component template specified has the highest precedence.

priority.description:
Priority to determine index template precedence when a new data stream or index is created.
The index template with the highest priority is chosen.
If no priority is specified the template is treated as though it is of priority 0 (lowest priority).
This number is not automatically generated by Opensearch.

schema.description: New index template definition, which will be included in the simulation, as if it already exists in the system
The configuration for the index (`settings` and `mappings`)

backing_indices.description: Total number of backing indices for the selected data streams.

data_stream_count.description: Total number of selected data streams.

data_streams.description: Contains statistics for the selected data streams.

total_store_size_bytes.description: Total size, in bytes, of all shards for the selected data streams.

indices.analyze#index.name: index
indices.analyze#index.description:
Index used to derive the analyzer.
If specified, the `analyzer` or field parameter overrides this value.
If no index is specified or the index does not have a default analyzer, the analyze API uses the standard analyzer.

indices.clear_cache#index.name: index
indices.clear_cache#index.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and aliases used to limit the request.
Supports wildcards (`*`).
To target all data streams and indices, omit this parameter or use `*` or `_all`.

indices.clear_cache#allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
indices.clear_cache#allow_no_indices.description:
If `false`, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias, or `_all` value targets only missing or closed indices.
This behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices.

indices.clear_cache#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
indices.clear_cache#expand_wildcards.description:
Type of index that wildcard patterns can match.
If the request can target data streams, this argument determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams.
Supports comma-separated values, such as `open,hidden`.
Valid values are: `all`, `open`, `closed`, `hidden`, `none`.

indices.clear_cache#fielddata.name: fielddata
indices.clear_cache#fielddata.description:
If `true`, clears the fields cache.
Use the `fields` parameter to clear the cache of specific fields only.

indices.clear_cache#fields.name: fields
indices.clear_cache#fields.description: Comma-separated list of field names used to limit the `fielddata` parameter.

indices.clear_cache#ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
indices.clear_cache#ignore_unavailable.description: If `false`, the request returns an error if it targets a missing or closed index.

indices.clone#index.name: index
indices.clone#index.description: Name of the source index to clone.

indices.clone#target.name: target
indices.clone#target.description: Name of the target index to create.

indices.clone#master_timeout.name: master_timeout
indices.clone#master_timeout.description:
Period to wait for a connection to the master node.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.
indices.clone#master_timeout.x-deprecation-message: To promote inclusive language, use 'cluster_manager_timeout' instead.

indices.clone#timeout.name: timeout
indices.clone#timeout.description:
Period to wait for a response.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

indices.clone#wait_for_active_shards.name: wait_for_active_shards
indices.clone#wait_for_active_shards.description:
The number of shard copies that must be active before proceeding with the operation.
Set to `all` or any positive integer up to the total number of shards in the index (`number_of_replicas+1`).

indices.data_streams_stats#name.name: name
indices.data_streams_stats#name.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams used to limit the request.
Wildcard expressions (`*`) are supported.
To target all data streams in a cluster, omit this parameter or use `*`.

indices.delete_alias#index.name: index
indices.delete_alias#index.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams or indices used to limit the request.
Supports wildcards (`*`).

indices.delete_alias#name.name: name
indices.delete_alias#name.description:
Comma-separated list of aliases to remove.
Supports wildcards (`*`). To remove all aliases, use `*` or `_all`.

indices.delete_alias#master_timeout.name: master_timeout
indices.delete_alias#master_timeout.description:
Period to wait for a connection to the master node.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.
indices.delete_alias#master_timeout.x-deprecation-message: To promote inclusive language, use 'cluster_manager_timeout' instead.

indices.delete_alias#timeout.name: timeout
indices.delete_alias#timeout.description:
Period to wait for a response.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

indices.exists_alias#name.name: name
indices.exists_alias#name.description: Comma-separated list of aliases to check. Supports wildcards (`*`).

indices.exists_alias#index.name: index
indices.exists_alias#index.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams or indices used to limit the request. Supports wildcards (`*`).
To target all data streams and indices, omit this parameter or use `*` or `_all`.

indices.exists_alias#allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
indices.exists_alias#allow_no_indices.description:
If `false`, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias, or `_all` value targets only missing or closed indices.
This behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices.

indices.exists_alias#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
indices.exists_alias#expand_wildcards.description:
Type of index that wildcard patterns can match.
If the request can target data streams, this argument determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams.
Supports comma-separated values, such as `open,hidden`.
Valid values are: `all`, `open`, `closed`, `hidden`, `none`.

indices.exists_alias#ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
indices.exists_alias#ignore_unavailable.description: If `false`, requests that include a missing data stream or index in the target indices or data streams return an error.

indices.exists_alias#local.name: local
indices.exists_alias#local.description: If `true`, the request retrieves information from the local node only.

indices.flush#index.name: index
indices.flush#index.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and aliases to flush.
Supports wildcards (`*`).
To flush all data streams and indices, omit this parameter or use `*` or `_all`.

indices.flush#allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
indices.flush#allow_no_indices.description:
If `false`, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias, or `_all` value targets only missing or closed indices.
This behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices.

indices.flush#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
indices.flush#expand_wildcards.description:
Type of index that wildcard patterns can match.
If the request can target data streams, this argument determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams.
Supports comma-separated values, such as `open,hidden`.
Valid values are: `all`, `open`, `closed`, `hidden`, `none`.

indices.flush#force.name: force
indices.flush#force.description: If `true`, the request forces a flush even if there are no changes to commit to the index.

indices.flush#ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
indices.flush#ignore_unavailable.description: If `false`, the request returns an error if it targets a missing or closed index.

indices.flush#wait_if_ongoing.name: wait_if_ongoing
indices.flush#wait_if_ongoing.description:
If `true`, the flush operation blocks until execution when another flush operation is running.
If `false`, Opensearch returns an error if you request a flush when another flush operation is running.

indices.forcemerge#index.name: index
indices.forcemerge#index.description: A comma-separated list of index names; use `_all` or empty string to perform the operation on all indices

indices.forcemerge#allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
indices.forcemerge#allow_no_indices.description: Whether to ignore if a wildcard indices expression resolves into no concrete indices. (This includes `_all` string or when no indices have been specified)

indices.forcemerge#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
indices.forcemerge#expand_wildcards.description: Whether to expand wildcard expression to concrete indices that are open, closed or both.

indices.forcemerge#flush.name: flush
indices.forcemerge#flush.description: Specify whether the index should be flushed after performing the operation (default: true)

indices.forcemerge#ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
indices.forcemerge#ignore_unavailable.description: Whether specified concrete indices should be ignored when unavailable (missing or closed)

indices.forcemerge#max_num_segments.name: max_num_segments
indices.forcemerge#max_num_segments.description: The number of segments the index should be merged into (default: dynamic)

indices.forcemerge#only_expunge_deletes.name: only_expunge_deletes
indices.forcemerge#only_expunge_deletes.description: Specify whether the operation should only expunge deleted documents

indices.forcemerge#wait_for_completion.name: wait_for_completion
indices.forcemerge#wait_for_completion.description: Should the request wait until the force merge is completed.

indices.get_alias#name.name: name
indices.get_alias#name.description:
Comma-separated list of aliases to retrieve.
Supports wildcards (`*`).
To retrieve all aliases, omit this parameter or use `*` or `_all`.

indices.get_alias#index.name: index
indices.get_alias#index.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams or indices used to limit the request.
Supports wildcards (`*`).
To target all data streams and indices, omit this parameter or use `*` or `_all`.

indices.get_alias#allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
indices.get_alias#allow_no_indices.description:
If `false`, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias, or `_all` value targets only missing or closed indices.
This behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices.

indices.get_alias#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
indices.get_alias#expand_wildcards.description:
Type of index that wildcard patterns can match.
If the request can target data streams, this argument determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams.
Supports comma-separated values, such as `open,hidden`.
Valid values are: `all`, `open`, `closed`, `hidden`, `none`.

indices.get_alias#ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
indices.get_alias#ignore_unavailable.description: If `false`, the request returns an error if it targets a missing or closed index.

indices.get_alias#local.name: local
indices.get_alias#local.description: If `true`, the request retrieves information from the local node only.

indices.get_data_stream#name.name: name
indices.get_data_stream#name.description:
Comma-separated list of data stream names used to limit the request.
Wildcard (`*`) expressions are supported. If omitted, all data streams are returned.

indices.get_field_mapping#fields.name: fields
indices.get_field_mapping#fields.description: Comma-separated list or wildcard expression of fields used to limit returned information.

indices.get_field_mapping#index.name: index
indices.get_field_mapping#index.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and aliases used to limit the request.
Supports wildcards (`*`).
To target all data streams and indices, omit this parameter or use `*` or `_all`.

indices.get_field_mapping#allow_no_indic.name: allow_no_indices
indices.get_field_mapping#allow_no_indic.description:
If `false`, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias, or `_all` value targets only missing or closed indices.
This behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices.

indices.get_field_mapping#expand_wildcar.name: expand_wildcards
indices.get_field_mapping#expand_wildcar.description:
Type of index that wildcard patterns can match.
If the request can target data streams, this argument determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams.
Supports comma-separated values, such as `open,hidden`.
Valid values are: `all`, `open`, `closed`, `hidden`, `none`.

indices.get_field_mapping#ignore_unavail.name: ignore_unavailable
indices.get_field_mapping#ignore_unavail.description: If `false`, the request returns an error if it targets a missing or closed index.

indices.get_field_mapping#include_defaul.name: include_defaults
indices.get_field_mapping#include_defaul.description: If `true`, return all default settings in the response.

indices.get_field_mapping#local.name: local
indices.get_field_mapping#local.description: If `true`, the request retrieves information from the local node only.

indices.get_index_template#name.name: name
indices.get_index_template#name.description: Comma-separated list of index template names used to limit the request. Wildcard (*) expressions are supported.

indices.get_index_template#local.name: local
indices.get_index_template#local.description: If true, the request retrieves information from the local node only. Defaults to false, which means information is retrieved from the master node.

indices.get_index_template#flat_settings.name: flat_settings
indices.get_index_template#flat_settings.description: If true, returns settings in flat format.

indices.get_index_template#master_timeou.name: master_timeout
indices.get_index_template#master_timeou.description: Period to wait for a connection to the master node. If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.
indices.get_index_template#master_timeou.x-deprecation-message: To promote inclusive language, use 'cluster_manager_timeout' instead.

indices.get_mapping#index.name: index
indices.get_mapping#index.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and aliases used to limit the request.
Supports wildcards (`*`).
To target all data streams and indices, omit this parameter or use `*` or `_all`.

indices.get_mapping#allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
indices.get_mapping#allow_no_indices.description:
If `false`, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias, or `_all` value targets only missing or closed indices.
This behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices.

indices.get_mapping#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
indices.get_mapping#expand_wildcards.description:
Type of index that wildcard patterns can match.
If the request can target data streams, this argument determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams.
Supports comma-separated values, such as `open,hidden`.
Valid values are: `all`, `open`, `closed`, `hidden`, `none`.

indices.get_mapping#ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
indices.get_mapping#ignore_unavailable.description: If `false`, the request returns an error if it targets a missing or closed index.

indices.get_mapping#local.name: local
indices.get_mapping#local.description: If `true`, the request retrieves information from the local node only.

indices.get_mapping#master_timeout.name: master_timeout
indices.get_mapping#master_timeout.description:
Period to wait for a connection to the master node.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.
indices.get_mapping#master_timeout.x-deprecation-message: To promote inclusive language, use 'cluster_manager_timeout' instead.

indices.get_settings#index.name: index
indices.get_settings#index.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and aliases used to limit
the request. Supports wildcards (`*`). To target all data streams and
indices, omit this parameter or use `*` or `_all`.

indices.get_settings#name.name: name
indices.get_settings#name.description: Comma-separated list or wildcard expression of settings to retrieve.

indices.get_settings#allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
indices.get_settings#allow_no_indices.description:
If `false`, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index
alias, or `_all` value targets only missing or closed indices. This
behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices. For
example, a request targeting `foo*,bar*` returns an error if an index
starts with foo but no index starts with `bar`.

indices.get_settings#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
indices.get_settings#expand_wildcards.description:
Type of index that wildcard patterns can match.
If the request can target data streams, this argument determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams.
Supports comma-separated values, such as `open,hidden`.

indices.get_settings#flat_settings.name: flat_settings
indices.get_settings#flat_settings.description: If `true`, returns settings in flat format.

indices.get_settings#ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
indices.get_settings#ignore_unavailable.description: If `false`, the request returns an error if it targets a missing or closed index.

indices.get_settings#include_defaults.name: include_defaults
indices.get_settings#include_defaults.description: If `true`, return all default settings in the response.

indices.get_settings#local.name: local
indices.get_settings#local.description:
If `true`, the request retrieves information from the local node only. If
`false`, information is retrieved from the master node.

indices.get_settings#master_timeout.name: master_timeout
indices.get_settings#master_timeout.description:
Period to wait for a connection to the master node. If no response is
received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an
error.
indices.get_settings#master_timeout.x-deprecation-message: To promote inclusive language, use 'cluster_manager_timeout' instead.

indices.get_template#name.name: name
indices.get_template#name.description:
Comma-separated list of index template names used to limit the request.
Wildcard (`*`) expressions are supported.
To return all index templates, omit this parameter or use a value of `_all` or `*`.

indices.get_template#flat_settings.name: flat_settings
indices.get_template#flat_settings.description: If `true`, returns settings in flat format.

indices.get_template#local.name: local
indices.get_template#local.description: If `true`, the request retrieves information from the local node only.

indices.get_template#master_timeout.name: master_timeout
indices.get_template#master_timeout.description:
Period to wait for a connection to the master node.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.
indices.get_template#master_timeout.x-deprecation-message: To promote inclusive language, use 'cluster_manager_timeout' instead.

indices.put_alias#index.name: index
indices.put_alias#index.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams or indices to add.
Supports wildcards (`*`).
Wildcard patterns that match both data streams and indices return an error.

indices.put_alias#name.name: name
indices.put_alias#name.description:
Alias to update.
If the alias doesnt exist, the request creates it.
Index alias names support date math.

indices.put_alias#master_timeout.name: master_timeout
indices.put_alias#master_timeout.description:
Period to wait for a connection to the master node.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.
indices.put_alias#master_timeout.x-deprecation-message: To promote inclusive language, use 'cluster_manager_timeout' instead.

indices.put_alias#timeout.name: timeout
indices.put_alias#timeout.description:
Period to wait for a response.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

indices.put_index_template#create.name: create
indices.put_index_template#create.description: If `true`, this request cannot replace or update existing index templates.

indices.put_mapping#index.name: index
indices.put_mapping#index.description: A comma-separated list of index names the mapping should be added to (supports wildcards); use `_all` or omit to add the mapping on all indices.

indices.put_mapping#allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
indices.put_mapping#allow_no_indices.description:
If `false`, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias, or `_all` value targets only missing or closed indices.
This behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices.

indices.put_mapping#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
indices.put_mapping#expand_wildcards.description:
Type of index that wildcard patterns can match.
If the request can target data streams, this argument determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams.
Supports comma-separated values, such as `open,hidden`.
Valid values are: `all`, `open`, `closed`, `hidden`, `none`.

indices.put_mapping#ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
indices.put_mapping#ignore_unavailable.description: If `false`, the request returns an error if it targets a missing or closed index.

indices.put_mapping#master_timeout.name: master_timeout
indices.put_mapping#master_timeout.description:
Period to wait for a connection to the master node.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.
indices.put_mapping#master_timeout.x-deprecation-message: To promote inclusive language, use 'cluster_manager_timeout' instead.

indices.put_mapping#timeout.name: timeout
indices.put_mapping#timeout.description:
Period to wait for a response.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

indices.put_mapping#write_index_only.name: write_index_only
indices.put_mapping#write_index_only.description: If `true`, the mappings are applied only to the current write index for the target.

indices.put_settings#index.name: index
indices.put_settings#index.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and aliases used to limit
the request. Supports wildcards (`*`). To target all data streams and
indices, omit this parameter or use `*` or `_all`.

indices.put_settings#allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
indices.put_settings#allow_no_indices.description:
If `false`, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index
alias, or `_all` value targets only missing or closed indices. This
behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices. For
example, a request targeting `foo*,bar*` returns an error if an index
starts with `foo` but no index starts with `bar`.

indices.put_settings#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
indices.put_settings#expand_wildcards.description:
Type of index that wildcard patterns can match. If the request can target
data streams, this argument determines whether wildcard expressions match
hidden data streams. Supports comma-separated values, such as
`open,hidden`.

indices.put_settings#flat_settings.name: flat_settings
indices.put_settings#flat_settings.description: If `true`, returns settings in flat format.

indices.put_settings#ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
indices.put_settings#ignore_unavailable.description: If `true`, returns settings in flat format.

indices.put_settings#master_timeout.name: master_timeout
indices.put_settings#master_timeout.description:
Period to wait for a connection to the master node. If no response is
received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an
error.
indices.put_settings#master_timeout.x-deprecation-message: To promote inclusive language, use 'cluster_manager_timeout' instead.

indices.put_settings#preserve_existing.name: preserve_existing
indices.put_settings#preserve_existing.description: If `true`, existing index settings remain unchanged.

indices.put_settings#timeout.name: timeout
indices.put_settings#timeout.description:
Period to wait for a response. If no response is received before the
 timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

indices.put_template#create.name: create
indices.put_template#create.description: If true, this request cannot replace or update existing index templates.

indices.put_template#master_timeout.name: master_timeout
indices.put_template#master_timeout.description:
Period to wait for a connection to the master node. If no response is
received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.
indices.put_template#master_timeout.x-deprecation-message: To promote inclusive language, use 'cluster_manager_timeout' instead.

indices.put_template#order.name: order
indices.put_template#order.description:
Order in which Opensearch applies this template if index
matches multiple templates.

Templates with lower 'order' values are merged first. Templates with higher
'order' values are merged later, overriding templates with lower values.

indices.recovery#index.name: index
indices.recovery#index.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and aliases used to limit the request.
Supports wildcards (`*`).
To target all data streams and indices, omit this parameter or use `*` or `_all`.

indices.recovery#active_only.name: active_only
indices.recovery#active_only.description: If `true`, the response only includes ongoing shard recoveries.

indices.recovery#detailed.name: detailed
indices.recovery#detailed.description: If `true`, the response includes detailed information about shard recoveries.

indices.refresh#index.name: index
indices.refresh#index.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and aliases used to limit the request.
Supports wildcards (`*`).
To target all data streams and indices, omit this parameter or use `*` or `_all`.

indices.refresh#allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
indices.refresh#allow_no_indices.description:
If `false`, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias, or `_all` value targets only missing or closed indices.
This behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices.

indices.refresh#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
indices.refresh#expand_wildcards.description:
Type of index that wildcard patterns can match.
If the request can target data streams, this argument determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams.
Supports comma-separated values, such as `open,hidden`.
Valid values are: `all`, `open`, `closed`, `hidden`, `none`.

indices.refresh#ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
indices.refresh#ignore_unavailable.description: If `false`, the request returns an error if it targets a missing or closed index.

indices.rollover#alias.name: alias
indices.rollover#alias.description: Name of the data stream or index alias to roll over.

indices.rollover#new_index.name: new_index
indices.rollover#new_index.description:
Name of the index to create.
Supports date math.
Data streams do not support this parameter.

indices.rollover#dry_run.name: dry_run
indices.rollover#dry_run.description: If `true`, checks whether the current index satisfies the specified conditions but does not perform a rollover.

indices.rollover#master_timeout.name: master_timeout
indices.rollover#master_timeout.description:
Period to wait for a connection to the master node.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.
indices.rollover#master_timeout.x-deprecation-message: To promote inclusive language, use 'cluster_manager_timeout' instead.

indices.rollover#timeout.name: timeout
indices.rollover#timeout.description:
Period to wait for a response.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

indices.rollover#wait_for_active_shards.name: wait_for_active_shards
indices.rollover#wait_for_active_shards.description:
The number of shard copies that must be active before proceeding with the operation.
Set to all or any positive integer up to the total number of shards in the index (`number_of_replicas+1`).

indices.segments#index.name: index
indices.segments#index.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and aliases used to limit the request.
Supports wildcards (`*`).
To target all data streams and indices, omit this parameter or use `*` or `_all`.

indices.segments#allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
indices.segments#allow_no_indices.description:
If `false`, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias, or `_all` value targets only missing or closed indices.
This behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices.

indices.segments#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
indices.segments#expand_wildcards.description:
Type of index that wildcard patterns can match.
If the request can target data streams, this argument determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams.
Supports comma-separated values, such as `open,hidden`.
Valid values are: `all`, `open`, `closed`, `hidden`, `none`.

indices.segments#ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
indices.segments#ignore_unavailable.description: If `false`, the request returns an error if it targets a missing or closed index.

indices.segments#verbose.name: verbose
indices.segments#verbose.description: If `true`, the request returns a verbose response.

indices.shard_stores#index.name: index
indices.shard_stores#index.description: List of data streams, indices, and aliases used to limit the request.

indices.shard_stores#allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
indices.shard_stores#allow_no_indices.description:
If false, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias, or _all
value targets only missing or closed indices. This behavior applies even if the request
targets other open indices.

indices.shard_stores#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
indices.shard_stores#expand_wildcards.description:
Type of index that wildcard patterns can match. If the request can target data streams,
this argument determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams.

indices.shard_stores#ignore_unavailable.name: ignore_unavailable
indices.shard_stores#ignore_unavailable.description: If true, missing or closed indices are not included in the response.

indices.shard_stores#status.name: status
indices.shard_stores#status.description: List of shard health statuses used to limit the request.

indices.shrink#index.name: index
indices.shrink#index.description: Name of the source index to shrink.

indices.shrink#target.name: target
indices.shrink#target.description: Name of the target index to create.

indices.shrink#master_timeout.name: master_timeout
indices.shrink#master_timeout.description:
Period to wait for a connection to the master node.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.
indices.shrink#master_timeout.x-deprecation-message: To promote inclusive language, use 'cluster_manager_timeout' instead.

indices.shrink#timeout.name: timeout
indices.shrink#timeout.description:
Period to wait for a response.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

indices.shrink#wait_for_active_shards.name: wait_for_active_shards
indices.shrink#wait_for_active_shards.description:
The number of shard copies that must be active before proceeding with the operation.
Set to `all` or any positive integer up to the total number of shards in the index (`number_of_replicas+1`).

indices.simulate_template#name.name: name
indices.simulate_template#name.description:
Name of the index template to simulate. To test a template configuration before you add it to the cluster, omit
this parameter and specify the template configuration in the request body.

indices.simulate_template#create.name: create
indices.simulate_template#create.description: If true, the template passed in the body is only used if no existing templates match the same index patterns. If false, the simulation uses the template with the highest priority. Note that the template is not permanently added or updated in either case; it is only used for the simulation.

indices.simulate_template#master_timeout.name: master_timeout
indices.simulate_template#master_timeout.description: Period to wait for a connection to the master node. If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.
indices.simulate_template#master_timeout.x-deprecation-message: To promote inclusive language, use 'cluster_manager_timeout' instead.

indices.split#index.name: index
indices.split#index.description: Name of the source index to split.

indices.split#target.name: target
indices.split#target.description: Name of the target index to create.

indices.split#master_timeout.name: master_timeout
indices.split#master_timeout.description:
Period to wait for a connection to the master node.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.
indices.split#master_timeout.x-deprecation-message: To promote inclusive language, use 'cluster_manager_timeout' instead.

indices.split#timeout.name: timeout
indices.split#timeout.description:
Period to wait for a response.
If no response is received before the timeout expires, the request fails and returns an error.

indices.split#wait_for_active_shards.name: wait_for_active_shards
indices.split#wait_for_active_shards.description:
The number of shard copies that must be active before proceeding with the operation.
Set to `all` or any positive integer up to the total number of shards in the index (`number_of_replicas+1`).

indices.stats#metric.name: metric
indices.stats#metric.description: Limit the information returned the specific metrics.

indices.stats#index.name: index
indices.stats#index.description: A comma-separated list of index names; use `_all` or empty string to perform the operation on all indices

indices.stats#completion_fields.name: completion_fields
indices.stats#completion_fields.description: Comma-separated list or wildcard expressions of fields to include in fielddata and suggest statistics.

indices.stats#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
indices.stats#expand_wildcards.description:
Type of index that wildcard patterns can match. If the request can target data streams, this argument
determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams. Supports comma-separated values,
such as `open,hidden`.

indices.stats#fielddata_fields.name: fielddata_fields
indices.stats#fielddata_fields.description: Comma-separated list or wildcard expressions of fields to include in fielddata statistics.

indices.stats#fields.name: fields
indices.stats#fields.description: Comma-separated list or wildcard expressions of fields to include in the statistics.

indices.stats#forbid_closed_indices.name: forbid_closed_indices
indices.stats#forbid_closed_indices.description: If true, statistics are not collected from closed indices.

indices.stats#groups.name: groups
indices.stats#groups.description: Comma-separated list of search groups to include in the search statistics.

indices.stats#include_segment_file_sizes.name: include_segment_file_sizes
indices.stats#include_segment_file_sizes.description: If true, the call reports the aggregated disk usage of each one of the Lucene index files (only applies if segment stats are requested).

indices.stats#include_unloaded_segments.name: include_unloaded_segments
indices.stats#include_unloaded_segments.description: If true, the response includes information from segments that are not loaded into memory.

indices.stats#level.name: level
indices.stats#level.description: Indicates whether statistics are aggregated at the cluster, index, or shard level.

indices.validate_query#index.name: index
indices.validate_query#index.description:
Comma-separated list of data streams, indices, and aliases to search.
Supports wildcards (`*`).
To search all data streams or indices, omit this parameter or use `*` or `_all`.

indices.validate_query#allow_no_indices.name: allow_no_indices
indices.validate_query#allow_no_indices.description:
If `false`, the request returns an error if any wildcard expression, index alias, or `_all` value targets only missing or closed indices.
This behavior applies even if the request targets other open indices.

indices.validate_query#all_shards.name: all_shards
indices.validate_query#all_shards.description: If `true`, the validation is executed on all shards instead of one random shard per index.

indices.validate_query#analyzer.name: analyzer
indices.validate_query#analyzer.description:
Analyzer to use for the query string.
This parameter can only be used when the `q` query string parameter is specified.

indices.validate_query#analyze_wildcard.name: analyze_wildcard
indices.validate_query#analyze_wildcard.description: If `true`, wildcard and prefix queries are analyzed.

indices.validate_query#default_operator.name: default_operator
indices.validate_query#default_operator.description: The default operator for query string query: `AND` or `OR`.

indices.validate_query#df.name: df
indices.validate_query#df.description:
Field to use as default where no field prefix is given in the query string.
This parameter can only be used when the `q` query string parameter is specified.

indices.validate_query#expand_wildcards.name: expand_wildcards
indices.validate_query#expand_wildcards.description:
Type of index that wildcard patterns can match.
If the request can target data streams, this argument determines whether wildcard expressions match hidden data streams.
Supports comma-separated values, such as `open,hidden`.
Valid values are: `all`, `open`, `closed`, `hidden`, `none`.

indices.validate_query#explain.name: explain
indices.validate_query#explain.description: If `true`, the response returns detailed information if an error has occurred.

indices.validate_query#ignore_unavailabl.name: ignore_unavailable
indices.validate_query#ignore_unavailabl.description: If `false`, the request returns an error if it targets a missing or closed index.

indices.validate_query#lenient.name: lenient
indices.validate_query#lenient.description: If `true`, format-based query failures (such as providing text to a numeric field) in the query string will be ignored.

indices.validate_query#rewrite.name: rewrite
indices.validate_query#rewrite.description: If `true`, returns a more detailed explanation showing the actual Lucene query that will be executed.

indices.validate_query#q.name: q
indices.validate_query#q.description: Query in the Lucene query string syntax.
